item.title: I own 179 BTC, here is my story * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
I own 179 BTC, here is my story * /r/Bitcoin

Bitcoin is the currency of the Internet: a distributed, worldwide, decentralized digital money. Unlike traditional currencies such as dollars, bitcoins are issued and managed without any central authority whatsoever: there is no government, company, or bank in charge of Bitcoin. As such, it is more resistant to wild inflation and corrupt banks.

item.title: Tyler Winklevoss: Gemini will have a positive effect on price of Bitcoin
item.description:
Tyler Winklevoss: Gemini will have a positive effect on price of Bitcoin

Tyler Winklevoss, one half of the ownership of New York Bitcoin exchange Gemini, is hopeful its compliance conscious approach will provide an on-ramp to big blue chips and push up the price of Bitcoin.

item.title: Fall 2015: Top Rated Bitcoin Wallets
item.description:
Fall 2015: Top Rated Bitcoin Wallets

Welcome to our Fall 2015 edition of the top rated and reviewed bitcoin wallets, where we highlight the best ranked bitcoin wallets on the market according to community reviews. For those unfamiliar with our website, we have the largest database of bitcoin wallets where we monitor every wallet and provide tools to the bitcoin community to rate and review each one.

item.title: What will Happen to Bitcoin when the Economy goes Bust?
item.description:
What will Happen to Bitcoin when the Economy goes Bust?

By Bitcoinist.net Oct 10, 2015 12:00 PM EDT Many people interested in Bitcoin have a less than optimistic view about the health of the global economy. This skepticism - in some cases pessimism - is fueled by a controversial business cycle theory that is fairly popular in Bitcoin circles.

item.title: Bitcoin - Open source P2P money
item.description:
Bitcoin - Open source P2P money

Bitcoin is an innovative payment network and a new kind of money. Find all you need to know and get started with Bitcoin on bitcoin.org.
